## Final Project - Check-in 1
DACSS 603, Spring 2023


Research Question: 

What is the research question you want to explore? This includes
references to existing literature, why you think your question is important and interesting
(motivation), and a general introduction to the subject matter.

How the office arrangement (work from home or on site), numbers of hours allocated and gender explain the level of burnout (burnout rate).


Hypothesis: 

Are there any existing hypotheses that weren’t tested before that you intend
to test for the first time or ones that you want to modify and test, or one you came up
with, or one that’s been tested and you’ll test with new data. What will be your
contribution?

Null hypothesis: WFH setup, Numbers of work hours allocated and gender does not affect the burnout rate.

Alternative hypotheses:

Females Working from home shows significantly higher burnout rate.

The numbers of work hours allocated affect the burnout rate significantly in WFH setup (vs on site).

Descriptive Statistics: 

https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/redwankarimsony/hackerearth-employee-burnout-challenge?resource=download


a description and summary of your data. How was your data
collected by its original collectors? What are the important variables of interest for your
research question? Use functions like glimpse() and summary() to present your data.





::: {.cell}

### a) What does the distribution of LungCap look like?


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Density histogram
hist(burn$Mental.Fatigue.Score, freq = FALSE, col="white", main = "Histogram of Probability Density for Lung Capacity", xlab = "Values", ylab = "Density")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](FelixBetancourt_Finalpart1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lines(density(burn$Burn.Rate), col = "blue", lwd = 2,)
```
